intro: Boechera carrizozoensis, commonly known as the Carrizozo bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Boechera carrizozoensis is also notable for its ecological role in supporting local pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
